feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Apps
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Apps Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Embedded map view doesn't show
entry.content:
I am creating an App with SAP Build Apps which requires the Embedded map view. A week ago I implemented that map and it worked fine. But two days ago it just stopped showing up. It doesn't show up on Desktop or Mobile. I tried multiple different browsers. I also created a new Project with just the map. Which also didn't work.

Was there an Update on Wendnesday? Before that day it all worked fine.

entry.title: SAP UI5 components inÂ SAP Build apps
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working and playing around in SAP Build apps(Mobile and Web application). I wondered that is there any way to use the SAP UI5 components in  SAP Build apps?.

Looking forward to hear some interesting things about it.

Thank you.

entry.title: SAP Build Apps: how do you mitigate the CORS issue when the app accesses another SAP BTP service?
entry.content:
I wonder what is the best method to solve the CORS issue specifically in the SAP Build Apps web app?

For example: I built an app which uses SAP AI Core. In the preview it works like charm, but when deployed, it throws the HTTP 403 error, which for sure is CORS-related.

What is the best method to solve this issue? Some properties in the BTP destination, defined in the Build Apps subaccount and leading to the SAP AI Core? Or any other method? Any ideas?

entry.title: Issues with page variable not being able to store values from data variable
entry.content:
Hi

URGENT HELP NEEDED

Any one facing issues with page variable not being able to store values from repeated.current formula; the data is being fetched from firestore database?

Note: Android preview works fine.

@timokapanen  if you could please check?

entry.title: APPGYVER Embedded Map View not rendering
entry.content:
• Problem: The built-in Map component no longer renders on any platform.

  • Tested On:

    • Existing app

    • New blank app (default map settings)

    • AppGyver Web Preview

    • AppGyver Android Preview

    • Generated APK (Android)

  • Symptoms:

    • Blank space where map should render

    • No console errors or loading indicators

  • Worked Before: Yes, up until aproximally 15th of June.

  • Urgency: Critical, app feature depends on built-in map.

Please advise if this is a known issue or when a fix is expected.

Thanks!

entry.title: CAP Action Not Triggered in SAP Build Process Automation Workflow Form
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Iâm working with SAP Build Process Automation and running into an issue where a CAP function is not being triggered from within a workflow form.

The action is defined as follows in CAP CDS, Cloud foundry runtime:

function functionQueryLandscapeObjects(
    search: Integer
) returns array of UILandscapeObjects;

In SAP Build Apps, Iâve added the service via the Action Editor and tested it there â everything works as expected. When I provide a valid search parameter (Business Partner ID), I get the correct data back.

However, in the actual workflow form, the function doesnât seem to be triggered at all. The setup is like this:

  • The user selects a customer from a dropdown.
  • Based on the selected customer, the functionQueryLandscapeObjects action should be triggered to load related landscapes/systems.
  • The search parameter is properly set up to reference the selected Business Partner ID.
  • But: when the landscape dropdown should be populated, nothing happens. No data is shown.
  • Also, the CAP app doesnât log anything in Cloud Foundry, which suggests the action isnât called at all.

Iâve double-checked the destination, the bindings, and the input logic, and everything seems fine.

Has anyone experienced something similar?
Do I need to explicitly wire the action to a form event in Build Process Automation? Or is there a limitation with calling parameterized actions from forms?

Any help or examples would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Is there any documentation to enable Joule Studio in SAP Build ?
entry.content:
Hi community,

Is there any documentation or steps to enable Joule Studio in SAP Build. Currently I only see below options. Am I missing any subscriptions/entitlements ?

entry.title: Find the Bug ð Formatting dates and times in Build Apps
entry.content:
Someone sent me a problem they were having in a private message, that made me chuckle.

To be honest, after 2 years of war and 2 weeks of intense war, and having to live out of a suitcase for a week in Athens because my plane was diverted and could not enter my country -- this was a fun, amusing diversion (it actually made me laugh).

Here's the message I received:

FORMAT_DATETIME_WITH_TIMEZONE(DATETIME("2025-04-03T02:00:00.000Z"), "MMM d, yyyy", "America/Chicago")

"I am using formula to format the date. Actually the output should be Apr 2, 2025, 9 pm. But I am getting Apr 3, 2025, 9 pm. How to solve this? I tried multiple ways. It's only changing time but not date. I used other timezone format as well. Please help. This is an issue in production."

After running the formula in my Build Apps and getting the same result, I assumed it was a bug in the tool (@Mari and @Pekka_Aaltonen, please forgive me). For the programmer, the obvious thing to think was that you asked for the date in the format April 2 (because it had to give the day before because the time zone they gave was minus 6 hours from UTC) and instead it was giving April 3. Why? Probably because the formula was too stupid to return the previous day's date.

It was supposed to show this:

But kept showing this:

But, alas, there was a perfectly logical explanation, but it was hidden because of the actual date and time used in the example. Another case of all-too-human error.

Can you find the bug?

P.S.: If you like this puzzle, wait for Devtoberfest in October. We'll have plenty more.

entry.title: problem connecting process automation with build app
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have build an business process automation, and created a destination 

sap_process_automation_service_user_access with following properties:

sap.cloud.service = com.sap.spa.processautomation

sap.cloud.service.alias = spa

saasregistryenabled = true

MobileEnabled = true

HTML5.DynamicDestination = true

CEP.EnableCsrfProtection = true

sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled = true

sap.processautomation.enabled = true

WebIDEEnabled = true

AppgyverEnabled = true

endpoints = blank

html5-apps-repo = blank

In the buildApp  App setting, BTP authentication is configured.   The process automation is released and published.  However, in the buildApp Integration section, the process automation is not shown.  Am I missing anything?  Is there anything else I need to set up/check?  I'd appreciate any guidance on the issue.  Thanks in advance.  

 

Lily

entry.title: Uploading Custom Flow Functions to Marketplace in SAP BUILD
entry.content:
I recently built several custom flow functions in one of my apps.  I would like to use these in my other apps without having to build it each time.  The only way I can think of to do that, would be to upload the new function to the marketplace.  Is there a way to do this?  I would love to make it available to other users as they are functions that would be great for everyone to have (one is a Switch that takes a single input and evaluate the condition to determine which of 11 outputs to trigger, instead of having to program 10 If Conditions each time.  The second one is similar, but it can trigger multiple outputs).

If there is no way for me to upload it, is there a way to request an addition to the marketplace?  I can provide all the info about how I built mine.

Single-Switch Flow and OutputsSingle-SwitchMulti-Switch

entry.title: How can we store static data in SAP Build Process Automation and access it in a Decision Table?
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (BPA), I want to store a set of static configuration data â for example, a JSON file that contains a list of Yes/No questions along with next-step logic.

I understand that BPA allows uploading static artifacts like JSON files into the project, but:

 My Questions:

  1. Can I access this static JSON data from within a Decision Table?

  2. If yes, how can I reference or read that static file inside a Decision Table?

  3. Is there a recommended way to make BPA Decision Tables dynamically configurable using such static files?

 What I'm Trying to Do:

I want to avoid hardcoding all rows in the Decision Table. Instead, Iâd prefer:

  • Storing a JSON or CSV file with the step-by-step rules

  • Having the Decision Table evaluate against that static data

  • Or programmatically update the table from that file (if possible)

Example JSON I want to use:

[
    {
        "step": 1,
        "question": "Is the requestor an employee?",
        "yesNext": 2,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    },
    {
        "step": 2,
        "question": "Is the budget approved?",
        "yesNext": 3,
        "noNext": "STOP"
    }
]
SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: Unable to see list data when I run the app
entry.content:
Hello,

So I am getting records from Salesforce and storing in a data variable and trying to display it on the SAP Build Apps.
When I configure the settings, I can see it in the app showing data while development but when I run a preview and try to run from my mobile, it is blank. I cannot see anything.

When I try to run a single record without repeat then it works perfectly fine.
Can anybody help me with what I am missing?

As you can see, I can see the data here coming from the salesforce based on my scan query but I cannot see it when I do a preview and run on my app.

Regards,
Ankita Mundhra

entry.title: Start and Stop recording audio not working in web app(chrome) using spa build apps
entry.content:
Hi Team,
I have successfully been able to implement audio recording in my mobile apps using the start recording audio and stop recording audio flow functions. But when I try to use the same flow functions in my web app. I keep getting errors such as:

- Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'audioFile') 

-Failed to execute 'requestData' on 'MediaRecorder': The MediaRecorder's state is 'inactive'.

Does anyone know how to record audio and get the audio file within SAP Build Apps community edition?

entry.title: build apps community edition builds to 99%, then says unknown error contact support
entry.content: Build Apps Community edition, gets to 99% in build process, then after about an hour says error unknown, contact support

entry.title: SAP Build Apps build error
entry.content:
SAP Build Apps, Community edition error when building. Get to 99% and after 1 hr it breaks giving an error of :

Error unknown, contact support.

Here is the error report as supplied by the builder;

{"buildId":"ee69cb9a-af44-4934-ad0b-44bb0357b9fc","appId":"226370","buildLogError":null}

I posted a similar query on wednesday, and even though there have been a lot of views, I have not received any response. My question now is;

Does Build Apps support monitor this board? 

Could this error be due to the fact that I am using the Community edition. If this is the case, please could someone recommend how to upgrade to another edition, as I would really like to continue using SAP Build Apps.

entry.title: Accessing deployed SAP Build Apps app in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello, how does deploying a SAP Build Apps app work? It seems to generate a URL when deployed via BTP. Is the app located in a Workzone?

Is it possible to use a deployed app's URL to access it via SAP Public Cloud Custom tile? If so, I imagine that the browser would open a new window  with the Build App application... Is it possible to open the custom made app within the SAP Public Cloud window? Similarly to how other native Public Cloud apps work?

How suitable SAP Build Apps even is as an extensibility option for SAP Public Cloud?

Thank you.

entry.title: add data variable option is disabled in sap build apps
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am new to SAP Build Apps, trying to create an app, however, add data variable option is disabled in sap build apps. Expecting experts advice. Thank you in advance.
